commits.message:
Create a new flow for doing releases that is less risky and better able to cope with failures.

Alter the flow of Spring Data releases to reduce risk, have better fallback positions, and still let the CI server do most of the work.

Switch to a 2-phased approach where 1st phase involves creating a release train tag and publishing it to GitHub. 2nd phase involves checkout that release train tag, building it, and staging it on Maven Central or Artifactory.

Either phase, if something goes wrong, is easier to recover from. 1st phase failures either result in nothing, or possibly having to back out each module's tag and a couple commits. 2nd phase involves deleting staged artifacts and trying again.

issue.title: Repository.findOne(Specification) & Repository.findOne(Example) fetches all data that matches the predicate with Hibernate

labels.name: status: waiting-for-triage
labels.description: An issue we've not yet triaged

comment.body:
https://github.com/spring-projects/spring-data-jpa/commit/f128375289101e0139c1b5b07803d96a10fb8dfb resolved this issue in `3.0.x` (now `main`). I just backported this fix to `2.7.x` and `2.6.x`.

Unfortunately, `2.6.x` has passed OSS support. While the patch is backported, unless a commercially-paying custom makes a request, no release for that version is presently scheduled. I recommend upgrading to at least Spring Data JPA 2.7.x.

issue.title: limit queries of single finders to 2
issue.body:
**Enhancement:**
Given a repositorys find-method returning a single result or an java.util.Optional should **limit** the underlying query to 2.

This would help to get the expected Result in case of multiple rows (IncorrectResultSizeDataAccessException) even if the query leads to huge result set.

(We had a case leading to an out of memory exception cause the query found about 50000 rows. Unfortunately we could not use a UniqueConstraint.)

commits.message:
Limit single finders max results to 2 for performance.

Closes #2594
Original pull request #2604

issue.title: limit queries of single finders to 2
issue.body:
**Enhancement:**
Given a repositorys find-method returning a single result or an java.util.Optional should **limit** the underlying query to 2.

This would help to get the expected Result in case of multiple rows (IncorrectResultSizeDataAccessException) even if the query leads to huge result set.

(We had a case leading to an out of memory exception cause the query found about 50000 rows. Unfortunately we could not use a UniqueConstraint.)

commits.message:
Limit single finders max results to 2 for performance.

Closes #2594
Original pull request #2604

issue.title: SimpleJPARepository: Methods accessing metadata.getComment() without Null-Check produce NPE

comment.body: I added additional `null` checks in `applyQueryHints` and `applyQueryHintsForCount` to further guard against this.

issue.title: SimpleJPARepository: Methods accessing metadata.getComment() without Null-Check produce NPE

commits.message:
Add additional null checks when applying hints.

It's possible to apply hints and hit a NullPointerException.

Resolves #2716.

issue.title: SimpleJPARepository: Methods accessing metadata.getComment() without Null-Check produce NPE

comment.body: Indeed, there are spots where the invoke of that method did a null check, but other spots where it does not.

issue.title: `SimpleJpaRepository.deleteById` throws `EmptyResultDataAccessException`
issue.body:
Hi,

in https://github.com/spring-projects/spring-data-commons/issues/2651 or more specifically in  https://github.com/spring-projects/spring-data-commons/issues/2651#issuecomment-1203611073 it was announced that `SimpleJpaRepository.deleteById` shouldn't throw an exception if there is nothing to delete.

It also notes that the behaviour should have been adjusted in the various modules, but apparently it wasn't:
> The behaviour of the various modules should get adopted for the 3.0 release.

Could this be still done even though 3.0.0 is already out now?

Cheers,
Christoph

commits.message:
Do not throw an exception for deleteById when no rows are found.

Comply with Spring Data Commons' new policy of not throwing an EmptyResultDataAccessException during deleteById.

Resolves: #2719.
Related: https://github.com/spring-projects/spring-data-commons/issues/2651
Build JAX-WS airline client module with Spring WS 4.0.
Build Spring WS airline client module with Spring WS 4.0.

issue.title: Create security example.
Create example for axis2 on 2.0.x.

commits.message: Build Spring WS airline client module with Spring WS 4.0.

Reduce jetty scope to test.

Resolves #1216.

Simplify mail dependencies.

Don't need com.sun.mail and jakarta-mail API. Also, only need them test-scoped.

Resolves #1217.

Replace jakarta.jakartaee-api with spec-specific JARs.

Resolves #1215.

Polish the release process with extra checks.

To reduce risk and ensure a proper release, extra steps and a checklist have been added to the release process.

Resolves #1237.

----------------------------------------

- #1289 - Upgrade to Jakarta EE 10 specifications.
- #1248 - Collapse identical catch branches.
- #1161 - Update Syntax and spellings.

labels.description: Pull requests that update a dependency file

issue.body: Related: https://issues.sonatype.org/browse/NEXUS-27902

issue.title: Upgrade to nexus-staging-maven-plugin 1.6.13.

labels.name: dependencies
labels.description: Pull requests that update a dependency file

issue.body: Related: https://issues.sonatype.org/browse/NEXUS-27902

issue.title: Use GitHub releases to track official releases.
issue.body: Add a changelog to track issues on a per-milestone basis.

comment.body: Pivot from publishing changelog reports inside releases to using GitHub releases.

commits.message:
Upgrade to Jakarta EE 10 specs.

Also include Jakarta EE 9 test profile.

Resolves #1289.

Introduce a Spring WS BOM.

Align with other projects from the portfolio and provide a spring-ws-bom to make it easier to manage dependencies.

Resolves #1205.

Remove Spring WS BOM.

Due to this pulling in other project BOMs, we will delay introducing a Spring WS BOM until a later release.

Resolves #1291.

Related: #1290.

Use Servlet 6.0.

While we test against Jakarta EE 9 in one profile, we must, in fact, use Servlet 6.0 across the board.

Related: #1292.

Collapse identical catch branches.

Also take advantage of Java's try-with-resources feature.

Resolves #1248.

Explicitly use jakarta-ee-10 profile for CI jobs.

Related: #1289.

Introduce changelog report.

Introduce a tool to collect and update the changelog.txt file. Ensure that updating this report is part of the pre-checks before doing a release.

Resolves #1295.

Migrate toward using Github releases.

Updated README procedures for doing a release. Capture output from ChangeLogCreator and use it in the release notes instead of maintaining a local changelog.txt.

Related: #1295.

Alter the flow of Spring Data releases to reduce risk, have better fallback positions, and still let the CI server do most of the work.

Switch to a 2-phased approach where 1st phase involves creating a release train tag and publishing it to GitHub. 2nd phase involves checkout that release train tag, building it, and staging it on Maven Central or Artifactory.

Create a new flow for doing releases that is less risky and better able to cope with failures.

Alter the flow of Spring Data releases to reduce risk, have better fallback positions, and still let the CI server do most of the work.

Switch to a 2-phased approach where 1st phase involves creating a release train tag and publishing it to GitHub. 2nd phase involves checkout that release train tag, building it, and staging it on Maven Central or Artifactory.

Either phase, if something goes wrong, is easier to recover from. 1st phase failures either result in nothing, or possibly having to back out each module's tag and a couple commits. 2nd phase involves deleting staged artifacts and trying again.
Mark up the scripts. Include TOOD.
Checkout release train before creating a tag.
Add missing steps to build proper dirs.
Checkout release train before creating a tag.
Add missing steps to build proper dirs.
Checkout release train before creating a tag.
Add missing steps to build proper dirs.
Mark up the scripts. Include TOOD.
Fix property names to not clash with env variables.

issue.title: Repository.findOne(Specification) & Repository.findOne(Example) fetches all data that matches the predicate with Hibernate

labels.name: status: waiting-for-triage
labels.description: An issue we've not yet triaged

comment.body:
https://github.com/spring-projects/spring-data-jpa/commit/f128375289101e0139c1b5b07803d96a10fb8dfb resolved this issue in `3.0.x` (now `main`). I just backported this fix to `2.7.x` and `2.6.x`.

Unfortunately, `2.6.x` has passed OSS support. While the patch is backported, unless a commercially-paying custom makes a request, no release for that version is presently scheduled. I recommend upgrading to at least Spring Data JPA 2.7.x.

issue.title: limit queries of single finders to 2
issue.body:
**Enhancement:**
Given a repositorys find-method returning a single result or an java.util.Optional should **limit** the underlying query to 2.

This would help to get the expected Result in case of multiple rows (IncorrectResultSizeDataAccessException) even if the query leads to huge result set.

(We had a case leading to an out of memory exception cause the query found about 50000 rows. Unfortunately we could not use a UniqueConstraint.)

commits.message:
Limit single finders max results to 2 for performance.

Closes #2594
Original pull request #2604

issue.title: limit queries of single finders to 2
issue.body:
**Enhancement:**
Given a repositorys find-method returning a single result or an java.util.Optional should **limit** the underlying query to 2.

This would help to get the expected Result in case of multiple rows (IncorrectResultSizeDataAccessException) even if the query leads to huge result set.

(We had a case leading to an out of memory exception cause the query found about 50000 rows. Unfortunately we could not use a UniqueConstraint.)

commits.message:
Limit single finders max results to 2 for performance.

Closes #2594
Original pull request #2604

issue.title: SimpleJPARepository: Methods accessing metadata.getComment() without Null-Check produce NPE

comment.body: I added additional `null` checks in `applyQueryHints` and `applyQueryHintsForCount` to further guard against this.

issue.title: SimpleJPARepository: Methods accessing metadata.getComment() without Null-Check produce NPE

commits.message:
Add additional null checks when applying hints.

It's possible to apply hints and hit a NullPointerException.

Resolves #2716.

issue.title: SimpleJPARepository: Methods accessing metadata.getComment() without Null-Check produce NPE

comment.body: Indeed, there are spots where the invoke of that method did a null check, but other spots where it does not.

issue.title: `SimpleJpaRepository.deleteById` throws `EmptyResultDataAccessException`
issue.body:
Hi,

in https://github.com/spring-projects/spring-data-commons/issues/2651 or more specifically in  https://github.com/spring-projects/spring-data-commons/issues/2651#issuecomment-1203611073 it was announced that `SimpleJpaRepository.deleteById` shouldn't throw an exception if there is nothing to delete.

It also notes that the behaviour should have been adjusted in the various modules, but apparently it wasn't:
> The behaviour of the various modules should get adopted for the 3.0 release.

Could this be still done even though 3.0.0 is already out now?

Cheers,
Christoph

commits.message:
Do not throw an exception for deleteById when no rows are found.

Comply with Spring Data Commons' new policy of not throwing an EmptyResultDataAccessException during deleteById.

Resolves: #2719.
Related: https://github.com/spring-projects/spring-data-commons/issues/2651
Build JAX-WS airline client module with Spring WS 4.0.
Build Spring WS airline client module with Spring WS 4.0.

Resolves #1237.

issue.title: Use GitHub releases to track official releases.
issue.body: Add a changelog to track issues on a per-milestone basis.

comment.body: Pivot from publishing changelog reports inside releases to using GitHub releases.

commits.message:
Upgrade to Jakarta EE 10 specs.

Also include Jakarta EE 9 test profile.

Resolves #1289.

Introduce a Spring WS BOM.

Align with other projects from the portfolio and provide a spring-ws-bom to make it easier to manage dependencies.

Resolves #1205.

Remove Spring WS BOM.

Due to this pulling in other project BOMs, we will delay introducing a Spring WS BOM until a later release.

Resolves #1291.

Related: #1290.

Use Servlet 6.0.

While we test against Jakarta EE 9 in one profile, we must, in fact, use Servlet 6.0 across the board.

Related: #1292.

Collapse identical catch branches.

Also take advantage of Java's try-with-resources feature.

Resolves #1248.

Explicitly use jakarta-ee-10 profile for CI jobs.

Related: #1289.

Introduce changelog report.

Introduce a tool to collect and update the changelog.txt file. Ensure that updating this report is part of the pre-checks before doing a release.

Resolves #1295.

Migrate toward using Github releases.

Updated README procedures for doing a release. Capture output from ChangeLogCreator and use it in the release notes instead of maintaining a local changelog.txt.

Related: #1295.
